Code syntax highlighting TOC

Basic syntax highlighting can be applied to preformatted text blocks, but it requires special attributes to be manually added to the blocks of code.

To apply syntax highlighting:

  1. Open the HTML source code editor

  2. Create a new <pre> element and paste in your preformatted code: You can also paste the code in the WYSIWYG editor and apply the "preformatted" format to it.

  3. Add name="code" to the <pre> element

  4. Add class="language" where language is one of the following supported languages: html, css, javascript, csharp, ruby, sql, xml

The opening tag should look something like this when you're done:

<pre name="code" class="html">

See the syntax highlighter wiki for additional configuration options.
